title: New Girl’s Lamorne Morris handcuffed for filming police arrest friend
text:
Lamorne Morris was handcuffed as he filmed police arresting his friend Picture: Getty)

Actor Lamorne Morris was put in handcuffs by police after he filmed them arresting his friend, who was bleeding from his mouth, outside a club in Hollywood.

Lamorne, 36, who stars as Winston Bishop in New Girl, had been enjoying a night out at Avenue nightclub in Los Angeles with a friend, when his pal apparently was attacked and left bleeding.

After police arrived, they arrested the friend, and Lamorne took his phone out to film the incident, which led to police putting handcuffs on him, too.

He told TMS reporters who were filming the incident: ‘[It’s] bulls**t man, that’s crazy to me. They walk up to the n***** bleeding out the mouth and they put him in handcuffs.

‘And I go, “wait, somebody hit him in the mouth”. And they go “someone said that he started something”.

‘We are half a block away from the f**king spot, but you ain’t putting nobody else, you’re not questioning nobody else and the only other person you put in handcuffs is the guy recording you. Alright.’

Lamorne starred as Winston Bishop in New Girl (Picture: Getty/FOX)

He claims police told him he was standing too close to them before they put him in handcuffs: ‘[They asked me] nothing. They just put me in cuffs because he said I didn’t give him enough space. He said “you gotta give me five feet”, I said “bro, I’m right here”. That’s ten feet!’

In footage filmed by TMZ, Lamorne can be seen standing with his mobile phone out filming as his friend stands in handcuffs with a policeman holding his arm.

Lamorne could be heard shouting: ‘Now they’re rushing me!’ as he continued to film while officers put his friend in the back of the police car and started to handcuff him too.

He was eventually let go and had the handcuffs taken off his wrists, but vented his annoyance to the waiting reporters who had captured the whole thing on camera.
